page.title: 10Farming in Fulford
page.content: The Bramleys farm 266 acres.The farms are mixed arable, dairy and beef. Crops are rotated over a one yearly cycle.This year there are 36 acres of oil seed rape,44 acres of potatoes,25 acres of sugar beet,55 acres of spring barley,30 acres of winter barley and 66 acres of winter wheat.There is a herd of 70 Friesian milk cows giving an average daily yield of 1000 litres.In summer the herd grazes on Heslington Tilmire.The herd overwinters in a barn and is fed silage,hay, cattle cake and dairy nuts.There are 16 heifers to replace dairy cows in two years time.Last year a dozen bull calves were fattened and sold.10 crossbred sheep are being kept for mutton.
